result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tarrin Denzel Griffin

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tarrin Denzel Griffin not in court, in custody.  Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs appeared by video for Tarrin Denzel Griffin.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant not produced. Discussion with parties. Defense counsel requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Court grants request. Case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 10.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 10:
Defendant Tarrin Denzel Griffin in court with Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs; both appear by video.  Defendant Tarrin Denzel Griffin in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 20FA1435. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer S. Horst. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court by video, defendant Tarrin Denzel Griffin not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Mr Griffin appeared by video prior to the case being called. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court prior to the case being called on the record.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The State's witness unavailable for today's court proceedings.  The matter adjourned for cause.

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court by video, defendant Tarrin Denzel Griffin not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defendant was moved from MSDF to Dodge. Dodge was unable to connect by video for todays proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Tarrin Denzel Griffin not in court, in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Order to Show Cause Hearing held.  Defense counsel was recently appointed and requests preliminary hearing date.  Court will waive any applicable time limits.  Case adjourned, Br. PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tarrin Denzel Griffin not in court, defendant in custody.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status of Counsel held.  Public defenders office has not apointed counsel at this time.  Court will schedule case for Order to Show Cause hearing by zoom.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Order to show cause hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Thomas Holland Reed in court, defendant Tarrin Denzel Griffin not in court, in custody.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Case in Court for a Hearing to Show Cause as to why an attorney has not been appointed yet.  State Public Defender's Office has been unable to appoint an attorney at this time for reasons stated on the record.  Case is adjourned to 5-24-22 at 8:30 am for status of counsel by zoom.
  This hearing will be streamed live on DAcast:

Defendant Tarrin Denzel Griffin not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing.  SPD has not appointed counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court.  Hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tarrin Denzel Griffin not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility. Defendant Tarrin Denzel Griffin not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No Contact Order signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $25,000.00.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

ADDRESS INFO for Tarrin Denzel Griffin
Current: 4446 N 76th St, Milwaukee, WI 53218   (Effective: 02-20-2022)
Prior: 8605 North Granville Road #3, Milwaukee, WI 53224
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ESR (DOB: 09/04/1999)

Defendant Tarrin Denzel Griffin in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Tarrin Denzel Griffin in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tarrin Denzel Griffin appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
